sequens: <entryFree id="n43812" type="main" key="se^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n43812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, from sequor.</sense></entryFree>
sequentia: <entryFree id="n43813" type="main" key="se^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sequor</etym>, <sense id="n43813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sequence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">context</hi>, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 1, 10</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 34" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 34</bibl> (dub.; al. consequentiae).</sense></entryFree>
sequester: <entryFree id="n43814" type="main" key="se^quester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquester</orth>, <itype>tris</itype> (orig. form sequester, tri. ante- and post - class., and in the poets), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n43814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depositary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trustee</hi>, into whose hands the thing contested was placed until the dispute was settled: <cit><quote lang="la">sequester dicitur, apud quem plures eandem rem, de quă controversia est, deposuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:110" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 110</bibl></cit>: nunc ut apud sequestrum vidulum posivimus, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 898</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu istunc hodie non feres, nisi das sequestrum aut arbitrum, Quoius haec res arbitratu fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sequestri placebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sequestro recte agetur depositi sequestrariā actione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: in sequestrum depositi actio competit; <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen cum sequestro convenit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕ-questrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestre</orth>, is), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the deposit of a subject of dispute with a third person</hi>: vitulum hic apponite: ego servabo quasi sequestro detis: neutri reddibo, donicum res judicata erit haec, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 692</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sequestro data,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequestro ponere: quod apud sequestrem depositum erat, sequestro positum per adverbium dicebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ad arbitrum redditur aut sequestro ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in later jurid. Lat.: in sequestro deponere (aliquid),</quote> <trans><tr>to put in sequestration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —Form sequestre: pecuniam sequestre <pb n="1677" /> <cb n="SEQU" /> ponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 33</bibl>: in sequestri deponere, Ps. - <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43814.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43814.2" n="A" level="2"> In cases of bribery of judges, electors, etc., <hi rend="ital">an agent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go-between</hi>, with whom the money promised was deposited (so always in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">internuntius): aut sequestres aut interpretes corrumpendi judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; so (with interpres) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 44</bibl>, § 108; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditor et corruptor et sequester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">19, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo sequestre in indice corrumpendo uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter, impudicus, sequester, convicium est, non accusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidatus per sequestrem agit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43814.3" n="B" level="2"> After the Aug. period, <hi rend="ital">a mediator.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43814.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Menenius Agrippa, qui inter patres et plebem publicae gratiae sequester fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:347" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 347</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 472</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sequester et medius fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—In this sense also a <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a mediatress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc fidei pacisque sequestra Mater eras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus quaedam stupri sequestra et adulterorum internuntia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in apposition: bis senos pepigere dies et pace sequestrā Per silvas Teucri mixtique impune Latini Erravere jugis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>under the protection of the truce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 133</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pace sequestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:425" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 425</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43814.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a means of negotiating</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">price</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suam pudicitiam sequestrem perjurii fieri passi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sequestra: <entryFree id="n43815" type="main" key="se^questra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sequester, II. B. 1.</entryFree>
sequestrarius: <entryFree id="n43816" type="main" key="se^questra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sequester, I.</etym>, <sense id="n43816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sequestration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in which the thing contested is deposited in the hands of a third party</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:9" default="NO">4, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sequestratio: <entryFree id="n43817" type="main" key="se^questra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sequestro</etym>, <sense id="n43817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depositing in the hands of a third party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sequestration</hi>, Cod. Th. 2, 28, 1.—</sense><sense id="n43817.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Complex. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sequestrator: <entryFree id="n43818" type="main" key="se^questra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that hinders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impedes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum familiarium (dolor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:53" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sequestratorium: <entryFree id="n43819" type="main" key="se^questra_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestrātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place where any thing is laid up for safe-keeping</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra seminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sequestro: <entryFree id="n43820" type="main" key="se^questro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquestro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sequester</etym> (late Lat. for sequestro do or pono; v. sequester, I.). <sense id="n43820.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give up for safekeeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surrender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis tibi (sc. terrae) membra sequestro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sepulturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43820.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">causam motūs ab eo, quod movetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a rerum publicarum actibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni ab infamiā vir sequestrandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequestratum animal,</quote> <trans><tr>separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequestrata verecundia,</quote> <trans><tr>laid aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 11, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sequior: <entryFree id="n43821" type="main" key="se^qui^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquĭor</orth>, <itype>us</itype>, <sense id="n43821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp. adj.</hi>, v. secus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sequius: <entryFree id="n43822" type="main" key="se^qui^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquĭus</orth>, v. secus.</entryFree>
sequor: <entryFree id="n43823" type="main" key="se^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquor</orth>, <itype>sĕcūtus</itype> (also written sequutus; <sense id="n43823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. sync.</hi> sequentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 111</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquo</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:8 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 8 sq.</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.) [Sanscr. sak-, to follow; sakis, friend; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/pomai, e(/pw</foreign>; cf. Lat. socius], <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43823.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43823.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43823.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i, jam sequor te, mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illa matrem satis honeste tuam sequi poterit comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:69 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 69 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex urbe amicitiae causā Caesarem secuti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sequerer moechas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars pressa sequuntur Signa pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:514" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 514</bibl></cit>; 9, 639; 10, 710 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43823.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq. in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">abi prae, jam ego sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 69</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Sequere intro. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Sequor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 23</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisnam est, qui sequitur procul?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus interim procedit: sequimur: ad sepulcrum venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curriculo sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii cum omnibus suis carris secuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nemo sequatur, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi sequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 78</bibl></cit>: hos falcati currus<cb n="SEQU" />  sequebantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos aliae gentes sequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.5" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">magna multitudo carrorum sequi Gallos consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Ulla (arbor) brevem dominum sequetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zonā bene te secutā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43823.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> in a hostile manner; <hi rend="ital">to chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudo genitas Pandione ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:666" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 666</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem sequendi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 68</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43823.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> in time or order; <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come after</hi> (esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): aestatem auctumnus sequitur, post acer hiems fit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 647</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 406 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sequens annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequente anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secuto die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secuta aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequenti senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secuturo Phoebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur hunc annum nobilis clade Romanā Caudinā pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne secutis quidem diebus Claudius ullius humani affectūs signa dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africanus sequens, i. e. minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 59, 59, § 211</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43823.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With the notion of cause implied, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut male posuimus initia, sic cetera sequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: increpuit; <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrum secuti nimbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae sunt verba secutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:780" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte sic loqui paenitet, Quā tempestate Paris Helenam et quae sequuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>and so on</tr>, <tr>and so forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.10" n="3" level="3"> Of a possession or inheritance, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fall to the share of</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">ut belli praeda Romanos, ager urbesque captae Aetolos sequerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut victorem res sequeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: si quis mortuos est Arpinatis, ejus heredem sacra non secuntur, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 629</bibl> P.—Abbreviated on monuments, H. M. H. N. S.: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredem possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 60, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus gloriam petebat, eo magis illum sequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; v. Fabri ad h. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf.: sequi gloria, non appeti debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go towards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">Formias nunc sequimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epirum, Cyzicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 381</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 629</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Itala regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.12" n="5" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> the hand in plucking or pulling; <hi rend="ital">to come off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come out; to come easily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come of itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae dum tenerae sunt vellendae: aridae factae celerius rumpuntur quam sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio mollis et tenera et ita flexibilis, ut sequatur, quocumque torqueas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam tenerum neque tam flexibile neque quod tam facile sequatur quocumque ducas, quam oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (ramus) volens facilisque sequetur, Si te fata vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scrutantes, quae vellant, telum non sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 21, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque secuta manum nullo cogente sagitta Excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 423</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 172, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahit ille manu sine custode lignum: Id quoque vix sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 372</bibl></cit>; cf.: cera mollis sequensque digitos, <hi rend="ital">yielding to</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n43823.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43823.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensue</hi> (usu. of an immediate consequence; <cit><quote lang="la">consequor, usu. of one more remote): si verbum sequi volumus, hoc intellegamus necesse est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: patrem sequuntur liberi, <hi rend="ital">succeed to the rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of their father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam hanc (Caesar) in re publicā viam, quae popularis habetur, secutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatum poenam sequi oportebat, ut igni cremaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>to befall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ne summa turpitudo sequatur,</quote> <trans><tr>should ensue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispares mores disparia studia sequuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post illas datas litteras secuta est summa contentio de domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: post gloriam invidiam sequi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an mediocre discrimen opinionis secuturum ex hac re putatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43823.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43823.16" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> (as a leader) an authority, a party, an example, a plan, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to follow in the track of; to comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accede to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conform to</hi>: sequi <cb n="SEQU" /> naturam, optimam bene vivendi ducem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequamur potissimum Polybium nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum sectam sequuntur multi mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sectam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 41, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 10 al.</bibl> (v. secta): <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchus regnum occupare conatus est ... hunc post mortem secuti amici, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum vel bellum patriae inferentem sequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem et consilium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so (with obtemperare voluntati) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam Scipionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos vestrumque factum omnia deinceps municipia sunt secuta,</quote> <trans><tr>have followed</tr>, <tr>imitated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec qui dicunt, quam rationem sequantur, vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum quoddam et subagreste consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeio esse in animo, rei publicae non deesse, si senatus sequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma victricia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.—Of an auditor, <hi rend="ital">to follow an orator</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos more prisco apud judicem fabulantes non auditores sequuntur, non populus audit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 23</bibl></cit>: non lingua valet, non corpore notae Sufficiunt vires, nec vox aut verba sequuntur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">attend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obey the will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 912</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo verba sequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 647</bibl></cit>. —Esp. milit. t. t.: signa sequi, <hi rend="ital">to march</hi> in rank, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> an end or object; <hi rend="ital">to strive for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to attain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (sc. utilitatem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ac tranquillitatem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitatem et salubritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam et nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nocuere (opp. fugere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sequar aut fugiam, quae diligit ipse vel odit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro extrema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurisque sequor disponere causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 529</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.18" n="3" level="3"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> in order or sequence; <hi rend="ital">to come next in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur is (rex), qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur illa divisio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sint dicta de aëre. Sequitur terra, cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac de primā quidem parte satis dictum est. Sequitur, ut doceam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:80 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 80 sq.</bibl></cit>— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur videre de eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:91:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 91, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4" default="NO">41, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43823.19" n="4" level="3"> In logical conclusions, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ensue;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si omne enuntiatum aut verum aut falsum est, sequitur ilico, esse causas immutabiles, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 21</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si haec enuntiatio vera non est, sequitur, ut falsa sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur igitur ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:18:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 18, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequitur ergo ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:40" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:17" default="NO">3, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:8 al" default="NO">6, 5, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43823.20" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come naturally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">easily; to be obtained without effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum hominis valuit exercitatio ut, cum se mente ac voluntate, conjecisset in versum, verba sequerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 194</bibl></cit> Sorof ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non quaesitum esse numerum, sed secutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua tacet nec vox tentataque verba sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 647</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:602" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 602</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbaque provisam rem non invita sequentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non omnia nos ducentes e Graeco sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus pulcherrima cum sequitur, non cum arcessitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>, prooem. § 8; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 6, 24: sequi gloria, non appeti debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">next</hi>, <hi rend="ital">next following</hi> in order (cf.: proximus, posterior; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): prius illud ... hoc sequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua morborum genera sequenti dicemus volumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 143</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with designations of time: <cit><quote lang="la">sequenti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>: sequenti die, Auct. B. Hisp. 28, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 36, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequente anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequenti nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; so also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO">4, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:2" default="NO">4, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 73, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 8, 21, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22</bibl>. 35, § 178; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suilium mox sequens aetas vidit praepotentem,</quote> <trans><tr>the next generation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl></cit> qui praesenti potentiā credunt exstingui <pb n="1678" /> <cb n="SERE" /> posse etiam sequentis aevi memoriam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 35</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, used by some for <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/qeton</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet</hi>, acc. to Quintilian; <cit><quote lang="la">as, dentes albi, umida vina ... o scelus abominandum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sequutio: <entryFree id="n43824" type="main" key="se^quu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕquūtĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĕquūtor</orth>, etc., v. sec-.</entryFree>
ser: <entryFree id="n43825" type="main" key="Se_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, v. Seres.</entryFree>
sera: <entryFree id="n43826" type="main" key="se^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. sero</etym>, <sense id="n43826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bar</hi> for fastening doors (not fixed to the door, but put on and taken off): sera, <foreign lang="greek">moxlo\s qu/ras</foreign>, Gloss. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">claustrum, obex): quā (serā) remotā fores panduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 108</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam contigerat portam, Saturnia cujus Dempserat oppositas insidiosa seras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:266" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sera suā sponte delapsa cecidit, remissaeque subito fores admiserunt intrantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seris transversis ita clathrare (vacerras), ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clauditur et durā janua fulta serā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:76" default="NO">1, 8, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obducere seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 48: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 636</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 710</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demere seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:280" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere poste seram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine vincitur sera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:347" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 347</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 630</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serapeum: <entryFree id="n43827" type="main" key="Se^ra_pe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrāpēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Serapis, A.</entryFree>
seraphin: <entryFree id="n43828" type="foreign" key="Se^ra^phi_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrăphīn</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrăphīm</orth>, <sense id="n43828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur. indecl.</hi>, = <foreign />, <hi rend="ital">the Seraphim</hi>, a higher order of angels among the Hebrews, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 5, 24 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
serapias: <entryFree id="n43829" type="greek" key="se^ra^pi^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrăpĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">serapia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n43829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> orchis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 95</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrăpĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serapicus: <entryFree id="n43830" type="main" key="Se^ra_pi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrāpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Serapis, B.</entryFree>
serapio: <entryFree id="n43831" type="main" key="Se^ra_pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrāpĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*serapi/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n43831.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an Egyptian ambassador to Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43831.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A geographer of Antioch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43831.2" n="3" level="3"> In Rome, as a name for slaves; <cit><quote lang="la">thus,</quote> <trans><tr>of a servant of Atticus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43831.3" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A nickname of</hi> P. Cornel. Scipio Nasica, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 616 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43831.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43831.5" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic of Hierapolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43831.6" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serapion: <entryFree id="n43832" type="main" key="se^ra^pi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrăpĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. serapias.</entryFree>
serapis: <entryFree id="n43833" type="main" key="Se^ra_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrāpis</orth> (a short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 531</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 100</bibl>), is and <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/ra=pis</foreign>, <sense id="n43833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief divinity of the Egyptians</hi>, subsequently worshipped also in Greece and Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 57</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 69</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 931</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">950</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">987</bibl>; 1887 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43833.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕ-rāpēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a temple of Serapis</hi>, the most celebrated in Alexandria, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43833.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrāpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Serapis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Serapian;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
serarius: <entryFree id="n43834" type="main" key="se^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serum</etym>, <sense id="n43834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living on whey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 150, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serdica: <entryFree id="n43835" type="main" key="Serdica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Serdica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mœsia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43835.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ser-dicensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Serdican</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Serdica</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43835.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Serdicēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Serdican</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Serdica</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serena: <entryFree id="n43836" type="main" key="Se^re_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman female name;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">the wife of Stilicho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogized by Claudian</hi>, v. Claud. Laud. Ser.</sense></entryFree>
serenator: <entryFree id="n43837" type="main" key="Se^re_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sereno</etym>, <sense id="n43837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that makes fair weather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the clearer-up</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, App. de Mundo, p. 75, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> p. 3</bibl>, n. 8; p. 3, n. 9; p. 4, n. 1 sq.; cf. serenus.</sense></entryFree>
serene: <entryFree id="n43838" type="main" key="se^re_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>serenus</etym>, <sense id="n43838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightly;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenius videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serenifer: <entryFree id="n43839" type="main" key="se^re_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serenusfero</etym>, <sense id="n43839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bringing fair weather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearing up</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquilo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 988</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prognost. 414</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
serenificus: <entryFree id="n43840" type="gloss" key="se^re_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serenusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n43840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleared up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>: COELO, <cb n="SERE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 855</bibl> (of the time of the emperor Antoninus Pius).</sense></entryFree>
serenitas: <entryFree id="n43841" type="main" key="se^re_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>serenus</etym>, <sense id="n43841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serenity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43841.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the weather, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serene weather;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: cum sit tum serenitas, tum perturbatio caeli, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei solisque, Auct. B. Hisp. 29, 4: auctumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 353</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla serenitas (opp. foeda tempestas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 26, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitatem praesagire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:188" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 67, 86, § 188</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vinea) imbribus magis quam serenitatibus offenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43841.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43841.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serenity</hi> of fortune, of disposition, etc. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): praesentis fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 62, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor es, quam ut serenitatem meam obducas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantam tempestatem subitā serenitate discussit (principis ortus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43841.4" n="2" level="3"> Serenitas, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Roman emperors</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">Serene Highness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3</bibl> epil.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 286, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sereno: <entryFree id="n43842" type="main" key="se^re_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. tranquillo). </sense><sense id="n43842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu, quo caelum tempestatesque serenat (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:637" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:665" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glauca terga aquae, Claud. de Apono, 36: domum largo igne,</quote> <trans><tr>to ligth up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: luce serenanti, <hi rend="ital">in bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear daylight</hi>, * Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.—</sense><sense id="n43842.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum serenat,</quote> <trans><tr>when it is clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 32, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43842.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem fronte serenat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 477</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: tristia fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:368" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 368</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
serenus: <entryFree id="n43843" type="main" key="se^re_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. svar, sky; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*sei/rios</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">se/las</foreign>; Lat. sol</etym>, <sense id="n43843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the poets; cf. sudus). </sense><sense id="n43843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cum tonuit laevum bene tempestate serenā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl> (Ann. v. 517 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caelo sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 260</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 518</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 321</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de parte caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regione caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 528</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo perfruitur sereniore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: o nimium caelo et pelago confise sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:870" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 870</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ex tam turbido die serena et tranquilla lux rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 426</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:718" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 718</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">color (opp. nubilus),</quote> <trans><tr>bright</tr>, <tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua (with candida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a wind <hi rend="ital">that clears the sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that brings fair weather</hi>: hic Favonius serenu'st, istic Auster imbricus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 35</bibl>; hence, also, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde serenas Ventus agat nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 461</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43843.2" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕrēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serene sky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair weather</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ponito pocillum in sereno noctu,</quote> <trans><tr>during a fine night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq. simply sereno: Priverni sereno per diem totum rubrum solem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare et sereno tonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl> (opp. nubilo), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 530</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquido ac puro sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitido sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie serenum cum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesique fides reditura sereni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:81" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenum nitidum micat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli serena Concutiat sonitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles et aperta serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:332" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 332</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43843.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cheerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus, tranquillus, secundus): vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1094</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">horae (with albus dies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:53" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 53</bibl></cit>: rebus serenis servare modum, <hi rend="ital">in propitious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favorable circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good fortune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:546" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons tranquilla et serena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora processu facta serena tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:461" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:546" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sereno vitae tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 48, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1094" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1094</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatus (sanguis) medium quoddam serenum efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem aliquid, pulsā curarum nube serenum Vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.5" n="2" level="3"> <cb n="SERI" /> SERENVS, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi> (whose brow was always serene), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1978, 5</bibl>; cf. Serenator; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, Martial calls Domitian: Jovem serenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:25:3" default="NO">9, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43843.6" n="3" level="3"> Serenissimus, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Roman emperors</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43844" type="main" key="Se^re_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕrēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. serenus</etym>, <sense id="n43844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43844.1" n="I" level="1"> Q. Serenus Sammonicus, <hi rend="ital">a physician under Septimius Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 3, 16, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43844.2" n="II" level="1"> Q. Serenus Sammonicus, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a poem</hi>, De Medicina, <hi rend="ital">still extant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. 30, 2</bibl>; cf. Teuffel's Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 379, 4.—</sense><sense id="n43844.3" n="III" level="1"> Serena, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Stilicho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother-in-law of the emperor Honorius</hi>, celebrated by Claudian in a special poem (Laus Serenae Reginae).</sense></entryFree>
seres: <entryFree id="n43845" type="main" key="Se_re^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sērĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sh=res</foreign>, <sense id="n43845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Eastern Asia</hi> (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Chinese</hi>), celebrated for their silken fabrics, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:1" default="NO">3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 67 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:403 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 403 al.</bibl>—Placed by Lucan at the sources of the Nile, and made neighbors of the Ethiopians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 292</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Serum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 13</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Seras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 12</bibl>, prooem. § 2.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> Ser, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Monos. Hist. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 668" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 668</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43845.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Seres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Seric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis (Müll. Neuricus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 8; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43845.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Seric</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">silken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 8, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpenta,</quote> <trans><tr>with silken curtains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 350</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n43845.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Seric garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:38:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:11" default="NO">11, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43845.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sērĭ-cum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Seric stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
