branches of learning</hi> (writing, reading, arithmetic, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. liberales, the higher branches),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 55</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">like a slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servilely.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n43938.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">servīle</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43938.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">servīlĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">serviliter ficti dominum consalutamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid serviliter muliebriterve faciamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:23:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
servilius: <entryFree id="n43939" type="main" key="Servi_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Servīlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Servīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n43939.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43939.2" n="A" level="2"> C. Servilius Ahala, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13 sq.</bibl>; v. Ahala.— </sense><sense id="n43939.3" n="B" level="2"> Cn. and Q. Servilius Caepio, <hi rend="ital">consuls</hi>, the former A.U.C. 613, the latter the following year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 97</bibl>; <cb n="SERV" /> 25, 43; 25, 161; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43939.4" n="C" level="2"> Another Cn. Servilius Caepio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 20, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43939.5" n="D" level="2"> Q. Servilius Caepio, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A.U.C. 648, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:49:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 49, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43939.6" n="E" level="2"> Q. Servilius Caepio, <hi rend="ital">quœstor</hi> A.U.C. 654, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Scaur. 1:2:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Scaur. 1, 2, 45</bibl> B. and K. al.—Others of the same name are mentioned, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43939.7" n="F" level="1"> C. Servilius Casca, <hi rend="ital">an assassin of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43939.8" n="G" level="1"> P. Servilius Casca, <hi rend="ital">an assassin of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n43939.9" n="H" level="1"> C. Servilius Glaucia, <hi rend="ital">prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Marius</hi> A.U.C. 654, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43939.10" n="K" level="1"> C. Servilius Isauricus, <hi rend="ital">a successful general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n43939.11" n="L" level="1"> Another P. Servilius Isauricus, <hi rend="ital">proconsul in Asia</hi> A.U.C. 708, to whom are addressed the letters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 66</bibl>-72; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43939.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> Servilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 12, 1 al.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n43939.13" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Servīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Servilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Servilian;</hi> familia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 38, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex, scilicet judiciaria, introduced by Q. Servilius Caepio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pecuniis repetundis, by C. Servilius Glaucia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 1, 2</bibl>; Ascon. ap. Scaur. p. 21; single fragments of which, still extant, are collected and explained in C. A. Klenze, Fragmenta legis Serviliae, Berol. 1825: agraria, proposed by P. Servilius Rullus, but defeated through the opposition of Cicero (Oratt. de lege Agr. III.); <cit><quote lang="la">Servilius lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in Rome</tr>, <tr>in the eighth region</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov 3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov 3, 7</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 238 and 139.—</sense><sense id="n43939.14" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Servīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Servilius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Servilian;</hi> horti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servio: <entryFree id="n43940" type="main" key="servi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ii, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n43940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> servibas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 50</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> servibo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> (once <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, v. I. B. infra) [servus], <hi rend="ital">to be a servant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in service</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43940.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43940.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol.: Ha.</hi> Quid tu, servusne es, an liber? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Nunc quidem etiam servio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc qui minus servio, quam si forem serva nata?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberatā terrā liberatores ejus servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per centum annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an addictus, quem lex servire, donec solverit, jubet, servus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Libertate caret, Serviet aeternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire liberaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serviet utiliter (captivus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">servire juste (opp. injuste imperare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:18:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 18, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincti per centum annos servistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servit vetus hostis Cantaber, serā domitus catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> of the person to whom service is rendered, <hi rend="ital">to be enslaved to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum est, tuos tibi servos tuo arbitratu serviat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitum tibi me abducito, ni fecero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire in eum locum, ubi parendum alteri et serviendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sive regi sive optimatibus serviant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc populorum intersit, utrum comi domino an aspero serviant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenas victas Lacedaemoniis servire pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minata, Servitura suo Capitolia nostra Canopo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 827</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43940.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam ille apud nos servit, quam ego nunc hic apud te servio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius meus illi apud vos servit captus in Alide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc pacto apud te serviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud lenonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis apud nos servisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With homogeneous object: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem: qui in servitute est eo jure, quo servus, aut, ut antiqui dixerunt, qui servitutem servit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu usque a puero servitutem servivisti in Alide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum majorum nemo servitutem servivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:6:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (cives) servitutem servissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 15, 5</bibl>: neque erile negotium plus curat quam si non servitutem <pb n="1683" /> <cb n="SERV" /> serviat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 150</bibl> (not servitute, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—So with <case>dat.</case> of person: <cit><quote lang="la">me servitutem servire huic homini optumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed is privatam servitutem servit illi an publicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit> (v. infra, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego haud diu: ab ineunte adulescentiā tuis servivi servitutem imperiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud hunc servitutem servio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passage): <cit><quote lang="la">adsuescamus ... servis paucioribus serviri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.7" n="II" level="1"> In gen., with <case>dat.</case> of object (a person or thing), <hi rend="ital">to be devoted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subject to; to be of use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">service to; to serve for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be fit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">useful for; to do a service to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comply with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodate; to have respect to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to regard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">care for; to consult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accommodate one's self to</hi>, etc. (so esp. freq. in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pareo, appareo, ministro): tibi servio atque audiens sum imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sibi (rei publicae) servissem semper, numquam mihi ... ut jam mihi servirem, consulerem meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 38, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servire populo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 27</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is, qui imperat aliis, servit ipse nulli cupiditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homines cupiditatibus iis, quibus ceteri serviunt, imperabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetati hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper aut belli aut pacis serviit artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori aliorum flagitiosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">compendio suo privato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitati (with consulere rei publicae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitati vocum aut suavitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:54:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 54, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel honori multorum vel periculo (with obedire tempori),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiae (with parere dolori),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudi et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudi existimationique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeris (orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei familiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitati salutique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustati vel maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78, 316</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 80, 327: verbis praecedentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 63</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut communi utilitati serviatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concisum est ita, ut non brevitati servitum sit, sed magis venustati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With homogeneous object (cf. supra, I. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ab ineunte adulescentiā Tuis servivi servitutem imperiis et praeceptis, pater ... Meum animum tibi servitutem servire aequom censui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n43940.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things. </sense><sense id="n43940.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be serviceable to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be useful for</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut totus truncus alienigenis surculis serviat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabularia debent servire gallinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartis serviunt calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelae luminibus et funeribus serviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 70, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eademque materia et cibis et probris serviat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetor quod domus aliquando C. Cassi, serviet domino non minori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43940.11" n="2" level="3"> Esp., jurid. t. t., of buildings, lands, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be subject to a servitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia, quae serviebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque servire quandam earum aedium partem in mancipi lege dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem numero (incorporalium) sunt et jura praediorum urbanorum et rusticorum, quae etiam servitutes vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl>, §§ 3 and 5; 8, 6, 8, § 1 al.; and v. servitus, II. B., and servus, II.</sense></entryFree>
servitium: <entryFree id="n43941" type="main" key="servi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>servus</etym>. <sense id="n43941.0" n="I" level="1"> In abstr., <hi rend="ital">the condition of a slave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slavery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi> (not so in Cic., who has servitus). <cb n="SERV" /> </sense><sense id="n43941.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hoc tibi pro servitio debeo, <hi rend="ital">as your servant</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum secum ipse reputaret, quam gravis casus in servitium ex regno foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>: neque desistam abstrahere a servitio civitatem nostram, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus nostris Jugurthae servitium minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus servitii insolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">servitii pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 3:61:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 61, 20</bibl></cit>; 3, 61, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 61, 11: ductus ab creditore in servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justum pati servitium (just before: regia servitus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum domus Assaraci Phthiam Servitio premet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem servitio levare,</quote> <trans><tr>to free from slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitio exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitium subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43941.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subjection</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">animi imperio, corporis servitio magis utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi etiam tauros primi docuisse feruntur Servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:1" default="NO">2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 488</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui servitium (amoris) ferre fatentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto infensius servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n43941.3" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a body of servants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the class of slaves</hi> (collect.; class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n43941.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nunc servitium'st,</quote> <trans><tr>such are servants nowadays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus agros locupletium plebi, ut servitio, colendos dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a servitio caveremus (cf. just before: examina tanta servorum immissa in populum Romanum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulline motus in Siciliā servorum Verre praetore ... facti esse dicuntur? ... coeptum esse in Siciliā moveri aliquot locis servitium suspicor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni faece urbis ac servitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calonum servitiique tertia (pars),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servitii decem milia offerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (gladiatores) e servitio Blaesi erant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43941.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia ad caedem et inflammandam urbem incitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula soluta sunt et servitia incitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera facessant, servitia sileant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes">46, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes">50, 1</bibl>; 56, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl> et al.—</sense><sense id="n43941.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of drones among bees: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt autem fuci ... quasi servitia verarum apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43941.7" n="2" level="3"> = servi, <hi rend="ital">servants</hi> as individuals: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia regum superborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia servitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilapsis etiam infimis servitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
servitor: <entryFree id="n43942" type="main" key="servi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>servio</etym>, <sense id="n43942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitor</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. Serm. ad Fratr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:43" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 43 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2363</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servitritius: <entryFree id="n43943" type="hapax" key="servi^tri_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servĭtrītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>servus-tritus, from tero</etym>, <sense id="n43943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">galled by slavery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabulum, as a term of abuse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit> dub. (Ritschl ex conj.: stabulum servitutium).</sense></entryFree>
servitudo: <entryFree id="n43944" type="main" key="servi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>servus</etym>, <sense id="n43944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slavery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi> (perh. only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">servitudinis homines expertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 2</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> dub. (Weissenb. servitutis): eritudo servitudo, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=83" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 83</bibl> Müll.: servitudo, <foreign lang="greek">doulei/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
servitus: <entryFree id="n43945" type="main" key="servi^tu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servĭtūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype> (<sense id="n43945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> servitutium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:1" default="NO">8, 3, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; and acc. to Ritschl also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the condition of a</hi> servus; <hi rend="ital">slavery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serfdom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43945.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus est constitutio juris gentium, quā quis dominio alieno contra naturam subicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem servire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit> (v. this freq. occurring phrase under servio, I. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): quibus nunc aerumna mea libertatem paro, Quibus servitutem mea miseria deprecor? Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 9</bibl> (Trag. v. 173 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">domi fuistis liberi: Nunc servitus si evenit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hodie fuerim liber, eum nunc potivit pater servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit> Fleck.: quis hoc imperium, quis hanc servitutem ferre potest? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsam (mulierem) in servitutem adjudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista corruptela servi si impunita fuerit ... fit in dominatu servitus, in servitute dominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors servituti anteponenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem perpessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae nationes servitutem pati possunt, populi Romani est propria libertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem pati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: similitudo servitutis <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl>: hunc nimis <cb n="SERV" /> liberum populum libertas ipsā servitute afficit, etc... Nimia illa libertas in nimiam servitutem cadit, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios nostros in servitutem abduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutis jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistocles cum servitute Graeciam liberasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuges in servitutem abstrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">addicere aliquem in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum populum servitute adficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asserere aliquem in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43945.2" n="(b)" level="5"> As a verbal noun with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: opulento homini hoc servitus dura est, <hi rend="ital">this serving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being servant of a rich man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43945.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43945.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (acc to servio, II.), <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjection</hi>: numquam salvis suis exuitur servitus muliebris; <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsae libertatem, quam viduitas et orbitas facit, detestantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestres gallinae in servitute non foetant,</quote> <trans><tr>in confinement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus tanti officii servitutem astringebam testimonio sempiterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim in illis ipsa merces auctoramentum servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se homines ad servitutem juris astringerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:16" default="NO">7, 3, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43945.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The government</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi> of a master: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi Apud me justa et clemens servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43945.6" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to servio, II. B.) Jurid. t. t., of buildings, lands, etc., <hi rend="ital">a liability</hi> resting upon them, <hi rend="ital">an easement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutes praediorum rusticorum sunt hae: iter, actus, via, aquaeductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura praediorum urbanorum, quae servitutes vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitute fundo illi imposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus servitutis putat aliquid habituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43945.7" n="D" level="2"> Concr. (for the class. servitium), <hi rend="ital">slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servants</hi> (collect.); <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of lovers: adde quod pubes tibi crescit omnis, Servitus crescit nova (= catervae amatorum semper novorum). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl> Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
servius: <entryFree id="n43946" type="main" key="Servi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Servĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43946.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman proper name</hi>, esp. in the Sulpician gens; whence Servii is sometimes used for Sulpicii, Oth. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 48</bibl>.—Esp., Servius Sulpitius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">an eminent jurist and statesman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Cicero</hi>, alled Servius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:76:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 76, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:244" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 244</bibl>; v. Sulpicius.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Servĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Servius Sulpitius the jurist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Servian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; for which also simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Servĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:7" default="NO">20, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:10" default="NO">20, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43946.1" n="II" level="1"> Servius Tullius, <hi rend="ital">the sixth king of Rome;</hi> v. Tullius.—</sense><sense id="n43946.2" n="III" level="1"> Servius Maurus Honoratus, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian under Valentinian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commentator on Vergil.</hi></sense></entryFree>
servo: <entryFree id="n43947" type="main" key="servo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n43947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> servasso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 71</bibl>: servassis, an old formula in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servassit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servassint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 103</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. salus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n43947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43947.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to save</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.; syn. salvo): <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Perdis me tuis dictis. <hi rend="ital">Cu.</hi> Immo servo et servatum volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 56</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ceteros servavi, ut nos periremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol me occidistis, amici, Non servastis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita ex hostium telis servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs ex belli ore et faucibus erepta atque servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (mostly post - Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen servari a furibus possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 5, 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super omnia Capitolium summamque rem in eo solus a Gallis servaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 103</bibl></cit>.—Mars pater, te precor, pastores pecuaque salva servassis duisque bonam salutem mihi, etc., an old formula of prayer, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te servassint semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te servassint mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me servet Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva, quod in te est, filium et me et familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: tu me amoris magis quam honoris servavisti gratiā. Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 316 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">invitum qui servat idem facit occidenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciae portus per se (i. e. Themistoclem) servatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1684" /> <cb n="SERV" /> servare rem publicam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam me unā vobiscum servare non possum, vestrae quidem certe vitae prospiciam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta cohortesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem insulamque Caesari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servabit odorem Testa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus Vitisator, curvam servans sub imagine falcem,</quote> <trans><tr>keeping</tr>, <tr>retaining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 179</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem et cives integros incolumesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam liberorum ab eorum libidine tutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se integros castosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: omnia mihi integra, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecta sanguine tela Conjugibus servant parvisque ostendere natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:188" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 188</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Absol.: So.</hi> Perii, pugnos ponderat. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Quid si ego illum tractim tangam ut dormiat? <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Servaveris: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam continuas has tres noctes pervigilavi,</quote> <trans><tr>you would save me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case> of the danger or evil: <cit><quote lang="la">si respublica populi Romani Quiritium ad quinquennium proximum salva servata erit hisce duellis, datum donum duit, etc., an ancient votive formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. SERVILIVS VVLNERE SERVATVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes quattuor amissis servatae a peste carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 699</bibl></cit>.—Usu. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ex judicio te ulla salus servare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs ex omni impetu regio servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem ex hieme marique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43947.4" n="b" level="4"> With abstract objects: navorum imperium servare est induperantum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 413 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 41</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem laboris quietisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia indiligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodias neglegenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimina rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentum (fides),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenorem pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides juris jurandi saepe cum hoste servanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem de numero dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilitatem juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura induciarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutum militare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 89: rectum animi, Hor S. 2, 3, 201: consulta patrum, leges juraque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam summā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis verecundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequam mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conubia alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:159" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi> for the future or for some purpose (syn. reservare): <cit><quote lang="la">si voles servare (vinum) in vetustatem, ad alvum movendam servato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum Massicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecuba centum clavibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis chernites mitior est servandis corporibus nec absumendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermes in melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se temporibus aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo me servavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valerius, in parvis rebus neglegens ultor gravem se ad majora vindicem servabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet esse quasdam res servatas judicio voluntatique multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod tempus quam integerrimas vires militi servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis auribus ista (carmina) Servas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa integra Caesari servaretur, Auct. B. Alex. 35, 1: durate et vosmet rebus servate secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 207</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Herculeos servaberis arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the idea of the attention being turned to any thing). </sense><sense id="n43947.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give heed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay attention to; to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> any thing (syn. observo). </sense><sense id="n43947.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43947.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: uxor scelesta <cb n="SERV" /> me omnibus servat modis, Ne, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palinurus dum sidera servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem locumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis limen servantis alumnae,</quote> <trans><tr>keeping watch over</tr>, <tr>guarding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:383" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascentes haedos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servaturis vigili Capitolia voce Cederet anseribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 538</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pomaria dederat servanda draconi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:646" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 646</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> or final: quid servas, quo eam, quid agam? Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 387, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus servus servet, Venerine eas (coronas) det, an viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decemviri servassent, ut unus fasces haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servandum in eo ante omnia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 28, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (triumviri) servarent, ne qui nocturni coetus fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43947.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep watch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">guard: Eu.</hi> Intus serva. <hi rend="ital">Sl.</hi> Quippini Ego intus servem? an, ne quis aedes auferat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 3 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in aedibus Servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus Sannio servat domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 627</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva!</quote> <trans><tr>take care! look out! beware!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">to observe</hi> an omen: secundam avem servat... servat genus altivolantum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 83 and 84 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 35, 74</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the augurs: de caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:61:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 61, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 429</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain in</hi> a place (i. e. to keep watch there); <hi rend="ital">to dwell in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabit</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc te amabo, ut hanc hoc triduum solum sinas Esse hic et servare apud me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nidum servas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria servantem postico falle clientem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae sorores, Centum quae silvas, centum quae flumina servant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanem hydrum Servantem ripas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola domum et tantas servabat filia sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DOMVM SERVAVIT, LANAM FECIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3848</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43947.14" n="C" level="2"> In late jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">servare aliquid (pecuniam) ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to get</tr>, <tr>obtain</tr>, <tr>receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:5:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 25, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:61" default="NO">26, 7, 61</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">servans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observant;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhipeus servantissimus aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 427</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
servula: <entryFree id="n43948" type="main" key="servu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">servŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>serva</etym>, <sense id="n43948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant-girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a young female servant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servulicola: <entryFree id="n43949" type="hapax" key="servu^li^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭlĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>servulus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n43949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that waits upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accommodates slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a slave's drab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
servulus: <entryFree id="n43950" type="main" key="servu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">servŏl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n43950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> servulum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 19</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>servus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a young slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant-lad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 58 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 62 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:16:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 8 al.</bibl>—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">homines servolos amare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
servus: <entryFree id="n43951" type="main" key="servus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">servus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>referred by the ancients to servo: <cit><quote lang="la">servi ex eo appellati sunt, quod imperatores servos vendere, ac per hoc servare, nec occidere solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; but prob. from root svar-; Lith. svaras, a weight; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/rma</foreign>; O. H.
