setia: <entryFree id="n44030" type="main" key="Se_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*shti/a</foreign>, <sense id="n44030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient mountain-city in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Pomptine Marshes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its excellent wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sezza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 42</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 26, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 32, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:112" default="NO">13, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 378</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">the wine produced there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Setian wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 90</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sētīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Setia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Setian</hi>: ager, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 26, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Setia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:103:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 103, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 86, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de montibus,</quote> <trans><tr>from the Setian vine-hills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva clivi Setini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 74, 11</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44030.1" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Setia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Setians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44030.2" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sētīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">The Setiness</hi>, the title of a comedy of Titinius (v. Com. Rel. p. 148 sq. Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n44030.3" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sē-tīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the wine of Setia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:2:7" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 86, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
setiger: <entryFree id="n44031" type="main" key="se_ti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sētĭger</orth>, v. saetiger.</entryFree>
setius: <entryFree id="n44032" type="main" key="seti_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">setīus</orth>, v. secus.</entryFree>
setosus: <entryFree id="n44033" type="main" key="se_to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sētōsus</orth>, v. saetosus.</entryFree>
setula: <entryFree id="n44034" type="main" key="se_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sētŭla</orth>, v. saetula.</entryFree>
seu: <entryFree id="n44035" type="main" key="seu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seu</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sive.</entryFree>
severe: <entryFree id="n44036" type="main" key="se^ve_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1, severus <sense id="n44036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
severitas: <entryFree id="n44037" type="main" key="se^ve_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. severus</etym>, <sense id="n44037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seriousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strictness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, in a good and bad sense (class. and very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. gravitas): tristis severitas inest in vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatem in senectute probo: acerbitatem nullo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit> (opp. lepos); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorum severitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitia et in omni re severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ipsā tristitiā et severitate popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illius comitatem et facilitatem tuae gravitati severitatique asperseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; so (opp. comitas) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 148</bibl>; (opp. mansuetudo et misericordia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 2</bibl>; (opp hilaritas risusque) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Torquatus cum illam severitatem in eo filio adhibuit, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evellere se aculeum severitatis vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetissimae vir severitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni severitas dignitatem addiderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commodare magnis peccatis severitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa severitas animadversionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum (opp. lenitas ac misericordia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: militarem disciplinam severitatemque minuere, Auct. B. Alex. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">65: nimia emendationis severitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac severitate aurium laetor,</quote> <trans><tr>this severity of taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44037.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam corruptissimo in genere magis tamen juvat quaedam ipsius viti severitas,</quote> <trans><tr>rudeness</tr>, <tr>crudeness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
severiter: <entryFree id="n44038" type="main" key="se^ve_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. severus <sense id="n44038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
severitudo: <entryFree id="n44039" type="main" key="se^ve_ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. severus</etym>, <sense id="n44039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gravity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi> (ante- and post-class. for the class. severitas): (frontis) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 3</bibl> (also cited <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 173, 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
severus: <entryFree id="n44040" type="main" key="se^ve_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. kindr. with serius</etym>, <sense id="n44040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> in aspect, demeanor, conduct, etc. (of persons and things; serius regularly only of things; v. serius; class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n44040.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">nam te omnes saevom severumque commemorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam severus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis severus et gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium gravissimus et severissimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tubero (Stoicus) vitā severus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum secta severissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae,</quote> <trans><tr>hardended by toil</tr>, <tr>rugged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zethus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores senum severiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of those who live a sober and temperate life: <cit><quote lang="la">at vos hinc abite, lymphae, Vini pernicies et ad severos Migrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adimam cantare severis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: neque severus esse (potest) in judicando, qui <pb n="1687" /> <cb n="SEVI" /> alios in se severos esse judices non vult, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 38</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">judices severi in eos solos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">severissimos atque integerrimos judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex familiā ad judicandum severissimā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi haec severus te palam laudaveram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor e severissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 52, 114, § 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristolaus e severissimis pictoribus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 137</bibl></cit> (for which, just before: austerior colore).— </sense><sense id="n44040.2" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crabbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus saevus severusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem acerbe severus in filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit> dub. (a passage bracketed by B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">in me severior quam in vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumenidum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 22; cf. II. B.—</sense><sense id="n44040.3" n="II" level="1"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austere</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">severā fronte curas cogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus severior et tristior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 289</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> A. P 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:241" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 241</bibl></cit>: Falernum, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tart</hi> (syn. austerum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divaeque (Palladis) severas Fronde ligare comas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus (opp. mitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina maxime severa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia severiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia severa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severiora judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severiores leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus severissimarum justissimarumque legum auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii severissimi vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego dixi per jocum, Id eventurum esse et severum et serium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linque severa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo severior poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae graves et severae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triste et severum genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 113</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:102" default="NO">6, 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:63" default="NO">9, 4, 63</bibl> sq.; 10, 1, 131 al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">severae Musa tragoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibus voces crevere severis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 216</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44040.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Severe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severus Uncus abest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heims,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem Cocyti metuet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.: Si.</hi> Accurrite, Ne se interimat ... <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Hau! voluisti istuc severum facere? <hi rend="ital">this horrible deed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 15</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 35</bibl> the correct read. is pelage sonora; v. Lachm. ad h. l.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms, severe (class.), severiter (anteand post-class.), and severum (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n44040.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter et severe voluptatem secernit a bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetuit (with graviter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimatae lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicare Hiempsalis mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO">8, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticam disciplinam regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem severius scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcere matrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui voluptatem severissime contemnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">exacta aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44040.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>: sermonem cum aliquo conferre, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 33</bibl>; and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.; Plaut., acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126, 33</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44040.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕvērum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">austerely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc severum vivitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44041" type="main" key="Se^ve_rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕvērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. severus</etym>, <sense id="n44041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44041.1" n="A" level="2"> Of several men. </sense><sense id="n44041.2" n="1" level="3"> Cornelius Severus, <hi rend="ital">a poet in the Augustan age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 2</bibl> sqq.; 4, 16, 9.—</sense><sense id="n44041.3" n="2" level="3"> Septimius Severus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, A.D. 193-211.—</sense><sense id="n44041.4" n="3" level="3"> Alexander Severus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, A. D. 222-235, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n44041.5" n="4" level="3"> T. Cassius Severus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the reigns of Augustus and Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:116" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44041.6" n="5" level="3"> Sulpicius Severus, <hi rend="ital">a bishop in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a</hi> Historia Sacra, <hi rend="ital">and of the</hi> Vita S. Martini, <hi rend="ital">and several smaller works.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44041.7" n="B" level="2"> Mons Severus, <hi rend="ital">a mountain in the country of the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 713</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sevianus: <entryFree id="n44042" type="main" key="Sevi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sevĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sevius</hi>: pira, <hi rend="ital">Sevian pears</hi>, a particular sort so called, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sevir: <entryFree id="n44043" type="main" key="se_vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvir</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexvir</orth> (in inscrr., where this word most freq. occurs, commonly written with numerals, VI. vir, or ĪĪĪĪĪĪ. VIR), <itype>vĭri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sex-vir</etym>, <sense id="n44043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a member of a board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college consisting of six men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sexvir.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44043.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of</hi> <cb n="SEXA" /> <hi rend="ital">the presidents of the six divisions of Roman knights</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 732</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2242</bibl>; 2258 al.—</sense><sense id="n44043.2" n="II" level="1"> Augustalis, <hi rend="ital">a member of the college of priests dedicated to Augustus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 2</bibl>; Inscr. Orell. t. ii. p. 197 sq.; v. Augustalis. —</sense><sense id="n44043.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A member of a municipal directory of six men</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 418</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">365, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seviralis: <entryFree id="n44044" type="main" key="se_vi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sevir</etym>, <sense id="n44044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sexvir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>of the equestrian sexvirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 6</bibl></cit>: cena, <hi rend="ital">of the Augustan sexvirs.</hi>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvĭrā-les</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Augustan sexvirs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ORDO SEVIRALIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2229</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1104, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seviratus: <entryFree id="n44045" type="main" key="se_vi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvĭrātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity of a sexvir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sexvirate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 71, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 400, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">150, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sevo: <entryFree id="n44046" type="main" key="Sevo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sevo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of northern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the island of Scandia</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Kjölen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Sweden and Norway</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sevoco: <entryFree id="n44047" type="main" key="se_vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n44047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call away</hi> to some particular place (class.; a favorite word of Cic.; syn. seduco). </sense><sense id="n44047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sevocare singulos hortarique coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime placitam (feminam ad stuprum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem in Aventinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis, ne quis postea populum sevocaret, capite sanxerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>should call a meeting of the people out of the city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu te solus e senatu sevocas?</quote> <trans><tr>separate yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. with inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">haud mediocriter de communi quicquid poterat ad se in privatam domum sevocabat,</quote> <trans><tr>put aside</tr>, <tr>withdrew</tr>, <tr>subtracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to call off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura me sevocat a doctis virginibus (i. e. Musis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a negotio omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a societate et a contagione corporis somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem a sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem ab oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:8:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his non multo secus quam a poëtis haec eloquentia sevocanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illuc est, quod ille solus se in consilium sevocat?</quote> <trans><tr>takes counsel with himself alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sevum: <entryFree id="n44048" type="main" key="se_vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sebum.</entryFree>
sex: <entryFree id="n44049" type="main" key="sex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sex</orth> (also written VI., and in inscrr. SEXS; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3745</bibl>), <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. shash, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/c</foreign>, Goth. saihs, Germ. sechs, Engl. six</etym>, <sense id="n44049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">six</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex aut septem loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex et nonaginta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex et quinquaginta milia passuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et sex milia peditum armati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Bis sex famulas (= duodecim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 272</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex septem,</quote> <trans><tr>six or seven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 58</bibl>; v. septem, sex primi, sexprimi.</sense></entryFree>
sexagenarius: <entryFree id="n44050" type="main" key="sexa_ge_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sexageni</etym>. <sense id="n44050.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing sixty</hi>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">a pipe sixty quarter-digits</hi> (quadrantes) <hi rend="ital">in diameter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 54" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PROCVRATIO,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>yielding sixty thousand sesterces</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 514, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44050.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">sixty years old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sexagenary;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man of sixty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sexagenarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero objurgantibus, quod sexagenarius Publiliam virginem duxisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hadrianus) obiit major sexagenario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Men sixty years of age were no longer admitted to vote in the saepta, and, if they attempted to enter, were thrust back from the bridge leading to them; whence arose the proverb, Sexagenarios de ponte, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 523, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl> Müll.; cf.: depontani. (Many Romans, at an early period, erroneously referred this expression to a religious usage, and even to original human sacrifices; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 1</bibl>. 1., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:621 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 621 sq.</bibl>）—In a sarcastic equivoque, of actually flinging a man into the Tiber, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sexageni: <entryFree id="n44051" type="main" key="sexa_ge_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (<sense id="n44051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sexagenūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 55" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 55</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi> [sexaginta]. </sense><sense id="n44051.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sixty each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo in plures ordines instruebantur: ordo sexagenos milites habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: SEXAGENOS DENARIOS VIRITIM DEDI, Monum. Ancyr. ap. Grut. 231: ibi scrobes effodito duplos sexagenos in die, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Prisc. <cb n="SEXI" /> p. 751 P.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sexagenos ternos pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propugnatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerunt uterum (canes) sexagenis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 40, 62, § 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 17, 19, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44051.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for sexaginta, <hi rend="ital">sixty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexagena milia modiūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>; of an indefinitely <hi rend="ital">large number</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 26, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sexageniquini: <entryFree id="n44052" type="main" key="sexa_ge_ni_qui_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēnī-quīni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n44052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib. adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sixty-five each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula sexagenumquinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sixty-five quarter-digits in diameter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 55" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexagesies: <entryFree id="n44053" type="main" key="sexa_ge_si^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēsĭes</orth>, v. sexagies.</entryFree>
sexagesimus: <entryFree id="n44054" type="main" key="sexa_ge_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n44054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [sexaginta], <hi rend="ital">the sixtieth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra sexagesimum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 79, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:70:1" default="NO">6, 70, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno quinto et sexagesimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (Hortensius) quarto et sexagesimo anno, perpaucis ante mortem diebus, defendit Appium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:324" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 94, 324</bibl></cit>: celebrasse quartum et sexagesimum natalem meum, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post Leuctricam pugnam die septingentesimo sexagesimo quinto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra sexagesimam diem, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars): <cit><quote lang="la">denarii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sixtieth part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexagies: <entryFree id="n44055" type="main" key="sexa_gi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgĭens</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāgēsĭes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 610</bibl>), <sense id="n44055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">sixty times</hi>: sestertium sexagies, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sixty times a hundred thousand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six millions of sesterces</hi> (v. sestertius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in the same sense, simply sexagies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexaginta: <entryFree id="n44056" type="main" key="sexa_ginta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexāginta</orth>, <pos>num. adj.</pos> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">e(ch/konta</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n44056.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">sixty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexaginta annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minorem annis sexaginta de ponte dejecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit> (v. sexagenarius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">major annis sexaginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 49, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante annos quinque et sexaginta, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae sexaginta quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, § 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n44056.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for an indefinitely <hi rend="ital">large number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexangulatus: <entryFree id="n44057" type="main" key="sexangu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sex-angŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>angulus</etym>, <sense id="n44057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sexangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hexagonal</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">crystallus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexangulus: <entryFree id="n44058" type="main" key="sexangu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sex-angŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sexangular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hexagonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae (apium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevor laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sexatrus: <entryFree id="n44059" type="gloss" key="sexa_tru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexātrūs</orth>, <itype>uum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sex</etym>, <sense id="n44059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sixth day after the Ides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexatrus ab Tusculanis post diem sextum Idus vocatur (dies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. v. Quinquatrus, p. 254 ib.</sense></entryFree>
sexcenarius: <entryFree id="n44060" type="hapax" key="sexce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sexceni</etym>, <sense id="n44060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of six hundred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes funditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexceni: <entryFree id="n44061" type="main" key="sexce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcēni</orth>, v. sesceni.</entryFree>
sexcenteni: <entryFree id="n44062" type="main" key="sexcente_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcentēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, v. sescenteni.</entryFree>
sexcentesimus: <entryFree id="n44063" type="main" key="sexcente_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcentēsĭmus</orth>, v. sescentesimus.</entryFree>
sexcenti: <entryFree id="n44064" type="main" key="sexcenti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcenti</orth>, v. sescenti.</entryFree>
sexcenties: <entryFree id="n44065" type="main" key="sexcenti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexcentĭes</orth>, v. sescenties.</entryFree>
sexcentoplagus: <entryFree id="n44066" type="main" key="Sexcento^pla_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sexcentŏ-plāgus</orth>, v. Sescentoplagus.</entryFree>
sexdecim: <entryFree id="n44067" type="main" key="sexde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexdĕcim</orth>, v. sedecim.</entryFree>
sexennis: <entryFree id="n44068" type="main" key="sexennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sex-annus</etym>, <sense id="n44068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of six years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexenni die,</quote> <trans><tr>after six years</tr>, <tr>an interval of six years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexennium: <entryFree id="n44069" type="main" key="sexenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sexennis</etym>, <sense id="n44069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of six years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">six years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer subripitur Sexennio prius quam moritur pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis tulerunt de provinciis contra acta Caesaris, ille biennium, hi sexennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sexies: <entryFree id="n44070" type="main" key="sexi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>, <sense id="n44070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> [sex]. </sense><sense id="n44070.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Six times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis sexies victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id sexies evenit per annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sexies ducendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>is to be taken six times</tr>, <tr>to be multiplied by six</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n44070.2" n="II" level="1"> For sextum, <hi rend="ital">for the sixth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mario sexies Valerioque Flacco Coss.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexis: <entryFree id="n44071" type="main" key="sexis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexis</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n44071.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The number six</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex duobus, triplo sexis implevit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 767</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44071.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Six</hi> asses: <hi rend="ital">s</hi> littera i praecedente finita neutra monoptota sunt, ut tressis, sexis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 305</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sexitanus: <entryFree id="n44072" type="main" key="Sexi_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sexītānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Saxētānus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pb n="1688" /> <cb n="SEXT" /> <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sex</hi> (called <foreign lang="greek">*se/c</foreign> by Ptolem.; Saxetanum in the Itiner.), <hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">Sexitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lacertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:78:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 78, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexprimi: <entryFree id="n44073" type="main" key="sexpri_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexprīmi</orth> (also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sex prī-mi</orth>; cf. decem primi, under decem), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sex-primus</etym>, <sense id="n44073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college of magistrates in provincial towns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of six members</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3756</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a member of such a board</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3242</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextadecimani: <entryFree id="n44074" type="hapax" key="sexta_de^ci^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextā-dĕcĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sextus</etym>, <sense id="n44074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the sixteenth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextaneus: <entryFree id="n44075" type="main" key="sexta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing six</hi> (in land-measuring): limes, <hi rend="ital">the sixth</hi>, Auct. Limit. pp. 239, 258 Goes. al.</sense></entryFree>
sextani: <entryFree id="n44076" type="main" key="sexta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the soldiers of the sixth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextans: <entryFree id="n44077" type="main" key="sextans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sex</etym>. <sense id="n44077.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sixth part of an</hi> as (v. as): <cit><quote lang="la">sextans ab eo quod sexta pars assis, ut quadrans quod quarta et triens quod tertia pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes in sextante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sextante heres institutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 9, 42, 8 pr.—</sense><sense id="n44077.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44077.2" n="1" level="3"> As a coin: <cit><quote lang="la">extulit eum plebs sextantibus collatis in capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 10, 48, § 138</bibl>; hence, servus sextantis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of very trifling value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44077.3" n="2" level="3"> In weighing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 74, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71, 9</bibl>; (with pondo) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 4" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:42 al" default="NO">42 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44077.4" n="3" level="3"> As a measure of land, <hi rend="ital">the sixth part of a</hi> juger, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44077.5" n="4" level="3"> As a liquid measure, <hi rend="ital">the sixth part of a</hi> sextarius, or <hi rend="ital">two</hi> cyathi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44077.6" n="5" level="3"> As a lineal measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44077.7" n="II" level="1"> Among mathematicians, <hi rend="ital">the sixth part of the number six</hi>, as of the numerus perfectus (v. as), i. e. <hi rend="ital">unity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextantalis: <entryFree id="n44078" type="hapax" key="sextanta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextantālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sextans</etym>, <sense id="n44078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a</hi> sextans: <cit><quote lang="la">fusi,</quote> <trans><tr>two inches thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
sextantarius: <entryFree id="n44079" type="main" key="sextanta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextantārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a</hi> sextans asses, i. e. <hi rend="ital">worth only the sixth part of the former</hi> asses (put in circulation after the second Punic war), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=347" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 347</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sextariolus: <entryFree id="n44080" type="hapax" key="sexta_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sextarius, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n44080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small measure</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">a pint</hi>, Aug. ap. Suet. Vit. Hor.</sense></entryFree>
sextarius: <entryFree id="n44081" type="main" key="sexta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sextus</etym>. <sense id="n44081.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the sixth part</hi> of a measure, weight, etc., Rhemn. Fann. Pond. 71; Fest. s. v. publica pondera, p. 246 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n44081.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44081.2" n="A" level="2"> As a liquid measure, <hi rend="ital">the sixth part of a</hi> congius, = <hi rend="ital">a pint</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 3</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 64 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44081.3" n="B" level="2"> As a dry measure, <hi rend="ital">the sixteenth part of a</hi> modius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:24" default="NO">2, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:1" default="NO">12, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 35, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:129" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 79, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:21:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 21, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextianus: <entryFree id="n44082" type="main" key="Sexti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sestianus, under Sestius.</entryFree>
sextilianus: <entryFree id="n44083" type="main" key="Sexti^li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl> and 4.</sense></entryFree>
sextilis: <entryFree id="n44084" type="main" key="Sexti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sextus</etym>, <sense id="n44084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sixth</hi>, only with mensis, of the month of August: MENSE SEXTILI, S. C. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextili menso caminus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mensis), <hi rend="ital">the sixth</hi> (<hi rend="ital">month</hi>); hence, <hi rend="ital">the month of August</hi>, acc. to the old Roman reckoning (counting from March), afterwards called Augustus (v. h. v., and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextilem totum mendax desideror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendae,</quote> <trans><tr>of August</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonae, Idus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sextilius: <entryFree id="n44085" type="main" key="Sexti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: C. Sextilius Rufus, Cass. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 48</bibl> tit.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sextilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from a Sextilius</hi>: pira, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sextius: <entryFree id="n44086" type="main" key="Sexti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextĭus</orth>, v. Sestius.</entryFree>
sexto: <entryFree id="n44087" type="main" key="sexto_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. sextus, B. 2.</entryFree>
sextula: <entryFree id="n44088" type="main" key="sextu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pars) <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sextus</etym>, <sense id="n44088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sixth part of an</hi> uncia, and, accordingly, <hi rend="ital">the seventy-second part of an</hi> as (v. as), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl> Müll.; Rhemn. Fann. Pond. 22: facit heredem ex duabus sextulis M. <cb n="SEXU" /> Fulcinium, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl>.—As a land measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:2" default="NO">5, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sextus: <entryFree id="n44089" type="main" key="sextus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n44089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [sex], <hi rend="ital">the sixth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus ab urbe lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:682" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus decimus ab Hercule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic annus sextus, postquam ei rei operam damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexto decimo anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus locus est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:53:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 53, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus decimus (locus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 56, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexta decima legio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">sexta decima (sc. hora),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 696</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, in one word: post sextumdecimum annum,</quote> <trans><tr>the sixteenth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdicat die sextodecimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextodecimo Calendas Jan.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:94" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 94</bibl></cit>.—In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus casus,</quote> <trans><tr>the ablative case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44089.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44089.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sextum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the sixth time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in M. Catonis quartā Origine ita perscriptum est: Carthaginienses sextum de foedere decessere. Id verbum significat, quinquies ante eos fecisse contra foedus, et tum sextum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextum consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44089.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sextō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">six times</hi>: lavit ad diem septimo aestate vel sexto, Treb. Gall. 17.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44090" type="main" key="Sextus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sextus</orth> (abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sex</orth>.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44090.1" n="1" level="3"> Sex. Roscius Amerinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44090.2" n="2" level="3"> Sex. Pompeius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 37, 4</bibl>.—In a play upon 1. sextus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 86</bibl>; v. annalis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sextusdecimus: <entryFree id="n44091" type="main" key="sextusde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sextusdĕcĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. sextus.</entryFree>
sexualis: <entryFree id="n44092" type="hapax" key="sexua_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexuālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sexus</etym>, <sense id="n44092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sexual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sexungula: <entryFree id="n44093" type="hapax" key="sexungu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sex-ungŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">six-claws</hi>, a Plautinian nickname for a rapacious prostitute, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sexus: <entryFree id="n44094" type="main" key="sexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sexus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ūs</orth> (<sense id="n44094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> sexibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 18, 10 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but sexubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. G. Alex. 1:36" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. G. Alex. 1, 36</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕcus</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root sec- of seco; hence properly, a division, segment</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44094.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sex</hi>, male or female (of men and beasts). </sense><sense id="n44094.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form sexus: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum genus et in sexu consideratur, virile an muliebre sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natus ambiguo inter marem ac feminam sexu infans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11</bibl></cit>; and: mare et femineum sexus, App de Mundo, c. 20, p. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum sexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 175</bibl></cit>: virilis sexus, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 70 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 55, 76, § 154</bibl> orbus virili sexu, Afran. ap. Fest. l. l. (Com. Rel. p. 166 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">liberi sexūs virilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puberes virilis sexūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres (liberi) sexūs feminini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes utriusque sexūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo sexūs discrimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: (<foreign lang="greek">sunezeugme/non</foreign>) jungit et diversos sexus, ut cum marem feminamque filios dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacra pro sexibus separavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44094.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form secus (in the poets and historians, in the latter usually virile or muliebre secus, as an <hi rend="ital">acc. resp.</hi> or limiting accusative, equivalent to the genitive or ablative of quality; v. Zumpt, Lat. Gram. § 428, for the preceding virilis sexūs, <hi rend="ital">the male sex</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">filiolam ego unam habui, Virile secus numquam ullum habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: virile secus, Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ejus virile secus futurum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secus muliebre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 70, 6</bibl></cit>: virile ac muliebre secus populi multitudo, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 27</bibl>: concurrentium undique virile et muliebre secus, Sall. H. Fragm. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 25</bibl>; and in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl> (p. 228 Gerl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut Philippi statuae ... item majorum ejus virile ac muliebre secus omnium tollerentur, Liv 31, 44, 4: multitudinem obsessorum omnis aetatis, virile ac muliebre secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas hominum virile et muliebre secus agebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum capitum virile secus ad decem milia capta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athletarum spectaculo muliebre secus omnes adeo summovit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destinatum Lacedaemoniis omnes virile secus interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.—Rarely as <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affluxere avidi talium ... virile ac muliebre secus, omnis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres ordine partae, Vesta, Ceres et Juno, secus muliebre, sorores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or as object of a verb: cur ex his unum secus virile designet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>: promiscue<cb n="SI" />  virile et muliebre secus trucidabant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44094.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44094.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sex</hi>, of plants and minerals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 14, 32, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:128" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 16, 25, § 128</bibl>; 36, 21, 39, § 149.—</sense><sense id="n44094.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sexual organs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
